awd_abstract_narration: An Image Processing Instructional Laboratory to be used for a new               senior course, Image Processing & Transmission, as well as for                  undergraduate compression, analysis, segmentation, and                          applications established.                                                                                                                                       A comprehensive undergraduate course on image processing with a                 well integrated laboratory component will benefit undergraduate                 students majoring in the electrical engineering as well as in                   other engineering and scientific disciplines.  Such a course is                 not widely available.  The requested equipment consists of four                 diskless workstations, each with color monitor, and a file                      server, with supporting peripheral equipment for hardcopy output                and network interfacing.  Software packages for this equipment                  will be obtained from public domain sources as well as from                     specific industrial laboratory sources.  Black and white color                  image data, both still and motion sequences, is already                         available, and more will be acquired from outside sources.
org_div_long_name: Division of Engineering Education and Centers
